com.buabook.kdb.query

Class KdbAsyncQuery

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.buabook.kdb.query.KdbQuery
      • com.buabook.kdb.query.KdbAsyncQuery
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public class KdbAsyncQuery
extends KdbQuery

    KDB Query Class - Asynchronous Implementation

    Based on KdbQuery provides an asynchronous (send query and wait locally for a response from process) means of communicating with a KDB process.

    (c) 2014 - 2015 Sport Trades Ltd
    Since:
    21 Jul 2014
    Version:
    1.0.1
    Author:
    Jas Rajasansir
    See Also:

        public Object query(String query)
             throws QueryExecutionFailedException
        Description copied from class: KdbQuery
        Method to query a kdb process with a string argument only. Example: "aFunction[]" or "aFunctionWithArgs[1;`symbol].

        Parameters:
        query - The string query to execute
        Returns:
        The query result

      • query

        public Object query(String query,
                    KdbDict arguments)
             throws QueryExecutionFailedException
        NOTE: This function does not perform any re-send of the query in case the connection fails (due to IOException). The calling function needs to ensure they re-send the query if they want to.
        Specified by:
        query in class KdbQuery
        Parameters:
        query - The function to execute
        arguments - The dictionary of arguments
        Returns:
        The query result
        Throws:
        QueryExecutionFailedException - If the query fails for any reason
